intro: Sphaeralcea coccinea subsp. dissecta, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers and palmate leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies dissecta is distinguished by its more finely divided leaves compared to other subspecies of Sphaeralcea coccinea.
